head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #24

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #24 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: in it ½m. – then turn'd 1st point on Lt 1m. went 1½ to a smooth rocky pt on Rt bay on Lt & an opening on Rt – then in a lac – cross'd over to a low pt of rocks SE4m. lac Spacious on both sides – then SbE4m. to a pt on Lt appearing like a narrow Channel, a larger one on the Rt pass'd a small rocky I. on Lt then cross'd SW3. to a rocky pt on Rt – spacious views on each side a rocky I. on Rt – same Co 1½ to a rocky pt on Lt being the entrance into a Strait, went in it near 2m. to a lac – SW6m. to a rocky pt on Lt sevl bays on Lt then SWbW along So shore to a pt on Rt which appears like a narrow Strait – pass'd between a rocky Isld on Lt & sevl on Rt 2 – then SSW to a pt on Lt 2m. (lac narrow) turn'd ye Pt leaving sevl smooth rocks on Rt & a wide Channel behind us, then entd a Strait, in which went 7m. to a lac – turn'd 1st pt on Rt & entd a bold Channel like a River, went in it 3m. when it opens into a lac Wt 4½ to a pt of wild rice on Rt 2 bays on Rt & 1 on Lt sevl Is on Rt – then Wt 3 to the pt an Isld on Rt Islands on both sides – then Travers'd SEbE2m. to a pt on Lt deep bay on Rt 1 isld on Lt – then coasted along the Id WNW1½ to 1st pt on Lt from which cross'd Wt 1¼ to the opposite Shore along which 1¼ to 1st pt on Rt[.] (Encamp'd[.]) [M]et a family today in 2 Canoes from whom we Traded a Moose-skin Tent & yesterday 1 cub Beaver & 2 cub Otters.

July 22 Thursday. From the point on Rt WbS6m. to a Strait between 2 Islands, pass'd 3 bays on Rt & some large Is on Lt – turn'd ye pt on Rt anor laying opposite, went along the end of the I ½m. & then turn'd upon ye Rt in a kind of Strait to a grassy pt on Lt 1m. – turn'd ye pt which is rocky & entd a Strait, having an opening & Is on Rt – went in it 2¾ when it opens into a kind of broken lac, pass'd an openg on Rt – then from a smooth rock in the middle of the Channel to a smooth rocky pt on Rt nearly SWbW1¼ an I. laying opposite – from ye rocky Pt it turns narrower, with a rocky Isld on Lt – went along Rt hand shore abt 1m. to a rocky pt on Rt – when it opens into a lac, 3 Isls appear in view on entg ye lac[,] went NWbN1¼ to the pt of an Id having them all on Rt – from the nearest isle cross'd over NbW2½ to a narrow strait rocky on both sides, pass'd a wide openg on Lt with Is in it – went in the Strait ¾ – then NbW¾ to the low rocky pt of an Id on Rt Is on Lt then ½ to a smooth rocky pt of an I opposite, then NNW to a low rocky Pt on Lt 3 then 1m. to a rocky pt on same side, passing an opening on Lt many Islds & spacious lac on Rt then 1½ to next pt on Lt a small bay on Lt (there ye lac opens wide, then Wt 3m. to a range of large Stones in the Chanl on Rt Is on each side & spacious lac on Rt then Wt 1m. to an island) wch I named Isle des Framboises on Acct of its being cover'd with most delicious ones, here the Indn we met yesterday & who retd with us pointed out to us a shorter one way to Port.

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
